doc.field: A. Cooke Hull election petition and memorial book
A. Cooke Hull election petition and memorial book

This collection contains a petition endorsing A. Cooke Hull as a candidate for alderman of Brooklyn's Third Ward, dated 1865, and a memorial book for Hull, presented on July 7, 1868 by the Board of Education of the City of Brooklyn.

This collection contains a petition endorsing A. Cooke Hull as a candidate for alderman of Brooklyn's Third Ward, dated 1865, and a memorial book for Hull, presented on July 7, 1868 by the Board of Education of the City of Brooklyn.

This collection contains a petition endorsing A. Cooke Hull as a candidate for alderman of Brooklyn's Third Ward, dated 1865, and a memorial book for Hull, presented on July 7, 1868 by the Board of Education of the City of Brooklyn.

Dr. A. Cooke Hull (1818-1868) was a resident of Brooklyn, a physician, a trustee of Public Schools 8 and 11 in Brooklyn, and a founder of the Long Island Historical Society (now the Brooklyn Historical Society).
Accession 1978.022 was purchased from Cedric L. Robinson Booksellers, 1978. The source and date of acquisition for accession 1979.014 are not known.
